intro: Waitzia lineata, commonly known as the lineated waitzia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves with a distinctive white vein pattern. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, and it produces small, dark berries as fruit. It is often found in shaded, humid environments within tropical forests.
